verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Trees they grow high, and leaves they do grow green Many is the time my true love I've seen Many an hour I've watched him run along He's young but he's daily growin'

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Father, dear father, you've done me great wrong You've married me to a boy who is too young 'Though I'm twice twelve, he is but fourteen He's young but he's daily growin'

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Daughter, dear daughter, I've done you no wrong I've married you to a brave lords son He'll be a man to you when I'm dead and gone He's young but he's daily growin'

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Father, dear father, if you'll see fit We'll send my love to college for one year yet I'll tie blue ribbons, all around his head To let the ladies know, he's mine

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: As I was looking over my fathers castle wall Saw the young boys, a playing at the ball My own true love was the flower of them all He's young but he's daily growin'

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: At the age of fourteen he was a married man Age of fifteen he held his son in his hands Age of sixteen, on his grave the grass was green Cruel Death had put an end to his growin'

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: I make my love a shroud of the Harlan so fine Every stitch I put in it the tears come a tricklin' down Once I had a true love, but now he is gone But I'll watch o'er his son while he's growin'
